original: ma zhig na mi 'jig pa de bzhin du gti mug rab tu zhi na nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma zhig na mi 'jig pa de bzhin du gti mug rab tu zhi na nyon mongs pa thams cad rab tu zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and when it is not cut down, it is not destroyed, so too, when delusion is completely pacified, all the afflictions are completely pacified.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ji ltar mgo bo bcad pa na //
analyzed: ji ltar mgo bo bcad pa na //
translated: Just as when the head is cut off,

original: srog ni rab tu mi 'jug pa //
analyzed: srog ni rab tu mi 'jug pa //
translated: life does not continue,

original: de bzhin gti mug bcad pa yis //
analyzed: de bzhin gti mug bcad pa yis //
translated: so too, when delusion is cut off,

original: nyon mongs 'khor lo 'jug mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nyon mongs 'khor lo 'jug mi 'gyur //
translated: the wheel of afflictions does not turn.

original: yang ji ltar don ma yin pa'i rtsa ba gti mug 'di spang bar rigs par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar don ma yin pa'i rtsa ba gti mug 'di spang bar rigs par bya zhe na /
translated: Moreover, how should this root of what is disadvantageous, delusion, be abandoned?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni //
translated: When dependent origination

original: mthong na gti mug 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mthong na gti mug 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Is seen, ignorance does not occur.

original: de phyir 'bad pa kun gyis 'dir //
analyzed: de phyir 'bad pa kun gyis 'dir //
translated: Therefore, with all your effort

original: gtam de kho na bsnyad par bya //üîΩgal te myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can rnams la rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gtam de kho na bsnyad par bya // gal te myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid can rnams la rang bzhin yod par 'gyur na ni /

original: de'i tshe de rnams rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de rnams rang gi ngo bos yod pa nyid kyi phyir ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If sprouts and such, which have internal and external natures, had intrinsic reality, then at that time, since they would exist by way of their own entities, they would not depend on ignorance, seeds, and so on.

original: grub par gyur pa ni yang bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: grub par gyur pa ni yang bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is already established does not need to be established again.

original: myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa 'di rnams ni ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: myu gu dang 'du byed la sogs pa 'di rnams ni ma rig pa dang sa bon la sogs pa'i tshogs pa la brten nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: These sprouts and such arise in dependence on the assembly of causes and conditions such as ignorance and seeds.

original: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin med pa yin la rang bzhin dang bral ba @113b nyid kyis kyang stong pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir gzugs brnyan dang sprul pa bzhin du rang bzhin med pa yin la rang bzhin dang bral ba @113b nyid kyis kyang stong pa'o //
translated: Therefore, because it is dependently arisen, like a reflection or an emanation, it is essenceless. And because it is devoid of essence, it is empty.

original: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag par mthong na gti mug spong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang dag par mthong na gti mug spong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, when one sees dependent origination correctly, ignorance is eliminated.

original: de spangs pa las kyang de la brten pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa spong ba'i thabs nyid kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nye bar ston pa don chen po yin pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi bstan bcos bzhi brgya pa 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung gis rten cing 'brel
analyzed: de spangs pa las kyang de la brten pa 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyang spong bar 'gyur ro // gang gi phyir de ltar ma rig pa spong ba'i thabs nyid kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba nye bar ston pa don chen po yin pa nyid kyi phyir bdag nyid thams cad kyi bstan bcos bzhi brgya pa 'dir 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung gis rten cing 'brel
translated: And through its elimination, attachment and so forth, which are based on it, are also eliminated.

original: bar 'byung ba'i gtam de nyid byed de /
analyzed: bar 'byung ba'i gtam de nyid byed de /
translated: Since the teaching of dependent origination is itself the means for eliminating ignorance, it is of great value. Therefore, in this treatise called the Catuhfi sÃÅataka, in all of its chapters, the teaching of dependent origination is presented.

original: zla ba nya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba nya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the full moon.

original: ji ltar zla ba nya bar gyur pa dang / mun pa 'jig pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas ye shes kyi zla ba shar bar gyur pas gti mug 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba nya bar gyur pa dang / mun pa 'jig pa de bzhin du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong bas ye shes kyi zla ba shar bar gyur pas gti mug 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the full moon destroys the darkness, so too the arising of the moon of wisdom through seeing dependent origination destroys delusion.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgti mug rkyen nyid 'di pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gti mug rkyen nyid 'di pa yi //
translated: Here we say:üîΩDelusion is not co-present

original: nyi ma'i 'od zer 'bar rnams dang // lhan cig gnas pa ma yin te //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od zer 'bar rnams dang // lhan cig gnas pa ma yin te //
translated: With the blazing light of the sun‚Äôs rays.

original: nyi ma'i zer dang mun pa bzhin //
analyzed: nyi ma'i zer dang mun pa bzhin //
translated: Like the sun‚Äôs rays and darkness,üîΩThey do not exist together.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi spong ba'i thabs ni smras na /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi spong ba'i thabs ni smras na /
translated: The method for abandoning attachment and so on has been explained.

original: yang de rnams la spyod pa'i sems can dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang de rnams la spyod pa'i sems can dag ji ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: But how should one understand sentient beings who engage in them?

original: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas bshad pa /
translated: In terms of their characteristics, we say:üîΩThe characteristics of those who are attached

original: rtag tu sa 'dzin sogs dga' ba'i //
analyzed: rtag tu sa 'dzin sogs dga' ba'i //
translated: Are always delighting in the earth and so on,

original: gtong po za po gtsang zhing 'gyur //
analyzed: gtong po za po gtsang zhing 'gyur //
translated: Being a giver, an enjoyer, pure, and changing.

original: de 'dra sogs la mtshan nyid rnams //
analyzed: de 'dra sogs la mtshan nyid rnams //
translated: These and other characteristics

original: 'dod chags can gyi mi la snang //
analyzed: 'dod chags can gyi mi la snang //
translated: Are seen in a person who is attached.

original: sa 'dzin pa'i gar dang / bzhad gang dang / 'jo sgeg dang / me tog dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / rgyan dang / kha dog la sogs pa la dga' ba dang / 'jam pa dang bde ba'i ngang tshul can dang /
analyzed: sa 'dzin pa'i gar dang / bzhad gang dang / 'jo sgeg dang / me tog dang / dri dang / phreng ba dang / byug pa dang / rgyan dang / kha dog la sogs pa la dga' ba dang / 'jam pa dang bde ba'i ngang tshul can dang /
translated: They are fond of dancing, laughing, joking, flowers, perfumes, garlands, ointments, jewelry, colors, etc. They are gentle and happy.

original: gtsang ba dang / mkhas bag dang / snyan par smra ba dang / gsong por smra ba dang / gtong ba po dang / za ba po dang 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gtsang ba dang / mkhas bag dang / snyan par smra ba dang / gsong por smra ba dang / gtong ba po dang / za ba po dang 'gyur ba ste /
translated: They are clean, clever, sweet-voiced, frank, generous, and changeable.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa dag ni 'dod chags la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa dag ni 'dod chags la spyod pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: These are the characteristics of those who are dominated by attachment.

original: de las bzlog pa dag ni zhe sdang la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa dag ni zhe sdang la spyod pa'o //
translated: Those who are dominated by aversion are the opposite.

original: 'dren ma dag ni gti mug la spyod pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'dren ma dag ni gti mug la spyod pa dag ste /
translated: Those who are dominated by delusion are a mixture of the two.

original: de ltar na ji skad bshad pa'i rtags dag gis bsam pa rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na ji skad bshad pa'i rtags dag gis bsam pa rjes su rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should infer the thought of another by means of the aforementioned signs.

original: nor bsgyur gyi sha za bzhin no //
analyzed: nor bsgyur gyi sha za bzhin no //
translated: Like a vampire who changes into a gold ingot.

original: ji ltar nor bsgyur mkhan yod na 'tshog chas rnam pa sna tshogs sdud par byed la de dor na @114a * //üîΩthams cad 'dor ba de bzhin du 'dod chags yod na 'tshog chas rnam pa sna tshogs sdud par byed la /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bsgyur mkhan yod na 'tshog chas rnam pa sna tshogs sdud par byed la de dor na @114a * // thams cad 'dor ba de bzhin du 'dod chags yod na 'tshog chas rnam pa sna tshogs sdud par byed la /
translated: Just as a merchant who has capital gathers various goods, but when he abandons that capital, he abandons all the goods.üîΩIn the same way, when one who is attached gathers various goods,

original: 'dod chags dor na thams cad 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dor na thams cad 'dor ro //
translated: but when one abandons attachment, one abandons all the goods.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dod chags kyis gzhan chags byed cing //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyis gzhan chags byed cing //
translated: One who is attached makes others attached

original: rang chags bya la cher dgar 'gyur //
analyzed: rang chags bya la cher dgar 'gyur //
translated: and is very pleased with what he is attached to.

original: sdang bas 'di dag las bzlog cing //
analyzed: sdang bas 'di dag las bzlog cing //
translated: One who is hateful does the opposite of this,

original: gti mug gis de rmongs par byed //
analyzed: gti mug gis de rmongs par byed //
translated: and one who is confused is deluded by that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la spyod pa la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid dag ni smras na /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang zhe sdang la spyod pa la sogs pa dag gi mtshan nyid dag ni smras na /
translated: The characteristics of those who engage in attachment and aversion, etc. have been explained.

original: yang de dag 'dul ba'i thabs ni gang zhig yin /
analyzed: yang de dag 'dul ba'i thabs ni gang zhig yin /
translated: But what is the method for taming them?

original: bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: bshad par bya ste /
translated: We reply:

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chags can la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis chags can la //
translated: The buddhas tame the attached

original: zas dang chos gos gtsug lag khang //
analyzed: zas dang chos gos gtsug lag khang //
translated: through food, Dharma robes, and temples.

original: dge legs spangs pa thams cad dang // rtag tu bla ma'i drung gnas gsungs //
analyzed: dge legs spangs pa thams cad dang // rtag tu bla ma'i drung gnas gsungs //
translated: and to always remain in the presence of the guru.

original: 'dod chags la spyod pas ni gnas dang zas dang chos gos 'dod chags dang bral ba skyed cing ser ba yid dang mi mthun pa dge legs spangs pa dag 'dod par bya'o zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dod chags la spyod pas ni gnas dang zas dang chos gos 'dod chags dang bral ba skyed cing ser ba yid dang mi mthun pa dge legs spangs pa dag 'dod par bya'o zhes sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, has said that those who are passionate should cultivate detachment from dwelling, food, and Dharma robes, and should desire the unpleasant, which is the abandonment of virtue.

original: de la 'dod chags can rnams kyis gtsug lag khang la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgon pa pa nyid dang / shing drung ba nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / blag pa med pa nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: de la 'dod chags can rnams kyis gtsug lag khang la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis dgon pa pa nyid dang / shing drung ba nyid dang / dur khrod pa nyid dang / blag pa med pa nyid gsungs so //
translated: In this regard, the Buddha, the Blessed One, has taught forest dwelling, dwelling at the foot of a tree, dwelling in a charnel ground, and not lying down as antidotes to the attachment of the passionate to monasteries.

original: mal sten la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni cog pu nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mal sten la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni cog pu nyid dang / gzhi ji bzhin pa nyid do //
translated: Sitting cross-legged and as-is-seated are antidotes to attachment to bedding.

original: zas la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid do //
analyzed: zas la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni bsod snyoms pa nyid dang / stan gcig pa nyid dang / zas phyis mi len pa nyid do //
translated: Begging for alms, eating in a single sitting, and not eating after rising are antidotes to attachment to food.

original: chos gos la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni chos gos gsum pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / phying ba pa nyid de //
analyzed: chos gos la zhen pa'i gnyen por ni chos gos gsum pa nyid dang / phyag dar khrod pa nyid dang / phying ba pa nyid de //
translated: The antidotes to attachment to the three robes are the disciplines of wearing only three robes, wearing robes made of rags, and wearing robes made of pieces of cloth.

original: de ltar na gtsug la khang dang / mal stan dang / kha zas dang / chos gos la zhen pa'i gnyen por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar na gtsug la khang dang / mal stan dang / kha zas dang / chos gos la zhen pa'i gnyen por sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan bcu gnyis rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, the Lord Buddha established the twelve ascetic practices as antidotes to attachment to a topknot, to a high or luxurious bed, to eating in a group, to eating at improper times, to attachment to taste, to attachment to robes, and to attachment to bowls.

original: yang gang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang 'di rnams bsten pa de ni bsod nams kyi zhing bdag nyid la ngan pa la mos pa'i skye bo rab tu dang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang gang 'dod chags dang bral ba dag kyang 'di rnams bsten pa de ni bsod nams kyi zhing bdag nyid la ngan pa la mos pa'i skye bo rab tu dang bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, those who are free from attachment should also practice these disciplines in order to inspire the faithful who are attached to their own inferior fields of merit.

original: de'i sgo nas de la dang ba rnams de'i nye bar bstan pas nges par @114b mya ngan las 'das par gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas de la dang ba rnams de'i nye bar bstan pas nges par @114b mya ngan las 'das par gzhol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are faithful in this way will certainly be led to nirvana through the example of these disciplines.

original: yang 'dod chags la spyod pa de ni rtag tu bla ma'i drung du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'dod chags la spyod pa de ni rtag tu bla ma'i drung du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, those who practice attachment should always be placed in the presence of a spiritual teacher.

original: de ltar na rtag tu bla mas bzhin bskul zhing 'phags pa'i rigs la rab tu gnas pa 'di'i 'dod chags thul bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de ltar na rtag tu bla mas bzhin bskul zhing 'phags pa'i rigs la rab tu gnas pa 'di'i 'dod chags thul bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, the passion of this person who is always urged on by the guru and who is well established in the family of the noble ones is subdued.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pas spad pas srab skyogs dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir mtshams las 'da' bar mi nus so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pas spad pas srab skyogs dang bcas pa nyid kyi phyir mtshams las 'da' bar mi nus so //
translated: And because he is restrained by the reins of proper mental attention, he is unable to overstep the bounds.

original: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni de las bzlog pa'i gtsug lag khang la sogs pa dag dang gnas rnam par dben pa'o //
analyzed: zhe sdang la spyod pa ni de las bzlog pa'i gtsug lag khang la sogs pa dag dang gnas rnam par dben pa'o //
translated: The person who is given to hatred should live in a temple, etc. that are the opposite of that, and in a solitary place.

original: gti mug la spyod pa ni 'dren ma dag go//üîΩbram ze'i srin pos bzung ba la mi gtsang ba ster ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gti mug la spyod pa ni 'dren ma dag go// bram ze'i srin pos bzung ba la mi gtsang ba ster ba bzhin no //
translated: The person who is given to delusion should live in a place that is mixed.üîΩJust as a person seized by a demon of the Brahmins is given impure substances to eat, and by that is cured.

original: ji ltar skyes bu gang zhig bram ze'i srin pos bzung bar gyur pa de la 'bru chang la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnams ster zhing des de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags can rnams la mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu gang zhig bram ze'i srin pos bzung bar gyur pa de la 'bru chang la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas rnams ster zhing des de 'gro bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'dod chags can rnams la mi sdug pa'o //
translated: Just as a person seized by a demon of the Brahmins is given impure substances such as fermented rice to eat, and by that is cured, so too, for the passionate, the meditation on the ugly is taught.

original: gang gis sten par byed pa'i mi //
analyzed: gang gis sten par byed pa'i mi //
translated: The person who is given to passion is cured by the meditation on the ugly.

original: nyon mongs zhi bar 'gyur ba de //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhi bar 'gyur ba de //
translated: The afflictions are pacified.

original: de yis brten bya gang gi phyir //
analyzed: de yis brten bya gang gi phyir //
translated: Because of that, one should rely on patience.

original: 'di la nyon mongs mi 'phel phyir //
analyzed: 'di la nyon mongs mi 'phel phyir //
translated: For the afflictions do not increase in one who is patient.

original: yang khro ba spang bar 'dod pas ni 'di ltar khro ba'i nyes dmigs dag rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: yang khro ba spang bar 'dod pas ni 'di ltar khro ba'i nyes dmigs dag rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, one who wishes to abandon anger should understand the faults of anger in the following way.

original: nus med la khro bdag nyid la //
analyzed: nus med la khro bdag nyid la //
translated: Anger is useless for one who is powerless.

original: mdog mi sdug pa 'ba' zhig byed //
analyzed: mdog mi sdug pa 'ba' zhig byed //
translated: It only makes one ugly.

original: nus pa gang la'ang brtse med pa //
analyzed: nus pa gang la'ang brtse med pa //
translated: One who is without compassion for anyone who is powerless

original: de ni tha chad ces byar brjod //üîΩgzhan la gnod par mi nus pa la ni khro ba skyes pa tsam gyis bdag nyid la mdog mi sdug pa 'ba' zhig byed kyi nus pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la gnod par ni mi byed do //
analyzed: de ni tha chad ces byar brjod // gzhan la gnod par mi nus pa la ni khro ba skyes pa tsam gyis bdag nyid la mdog mi sdug pa 'ba' zhig byed kyi nus pa dang mi ldan pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan dag la gnod par ni mi byed do //
translated: is said to be the worst of men.üîΩAnger is useless for one who is powerless, because when one is powerless, the mere arising of anger only makes one ugly, and one is unable to harm another.

original: gzhan dag la gnod phod cing nus pa la yang gal te nus pa med pa la gnod pa la brtse ba med na ni de gnod pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir tha chad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la gnod phod cing nus pa la yang gal te nus pa med pa la gnod pa la brtse ba med na ni de gnod pa thams cad kyi rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir tha chad du 'gyur te /
translated: One who is able to harm another and is also without compassion for one who is powerless is the worst of men, because he is the cause of all harm.

original: srog 'joms pa ni gnod pa tha chad yin pa de nyid kyi phyir gang zag 'di la yang tha chad ces bya'o //
analyzed: srog 'joms pa ni gnod pa tha chad yin pa de nyid kyi phyir gang zag 'di la yang tha chad ces bya'o //
translated: Because the destruction of life is the worst of all injuries, this person is called the worst.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zhig brtse ba med par gyur nas nyam chung ba dag la bsnun pa de las ma gtogs pa brtse ba med pa gzhan med pa'i phyir tha chad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na gang zhig brtse ba med par gyur nas nyam chung ba dag la bsnun pa de las ma gtogs pa brtse ba med pa gzhan med pa'i phyir tha chad du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, because there is no other injury worse than that which is done without compassion to those who are weak, this is the worst.

original: rigs la gnod pa bzhin no //üîΩji ltar rigs kyi nang nas gcig gis nyes par 'gyur ba bzhin du thams cad chad pa dang @115a * //
analyzed: rigs la gnod pa bzhin no // ji ltar rigs kyi nang nas gcig gis nyes par 'gyur ba bzhin du thams cad chad pa dang @115a * //
translated: Like the injury to a family.üîΩJust as when one person in a family is injured, all are injured; or when one person in a family is successful, all are successful; in the same way, when one person in a family is angry, all become angry.

original: sbyor ba'am / brlag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnod sems la spyod pa'i gnod sems kyang rnam pa thams cad du phung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'am / brlag par 'gyur ba de bzhin du gnod sems la spyod pa'i gnod sems kyang rnam pa thams cad du phung bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, when one person in a family is angry, all become angry.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: me dang khro ba byung bas ni //
analyzed: me dang khro ba byung bas ni //
translated: When fire and anger arise,

original: dang por ci nas de gnyis sreg / phyi nas 'tshed par gyur pas na //
analyzed: dang por ci nas de gnyis sreg / phyi nas 'tshed par gyur pas na //

original: sdug bsngal gang zhig bsags pa na 'phags pa rnams 'khor ba las skyo bar 'gyur ba de gal te so so'i skye bos mngon sum du bya bar nus na ni de'i tshe skad cig de nyid la 'di'i snying lus dang lhan cig tu rnam pa brgyar 'jig par
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zhig bsags pa na 'phags pa rnams 'khor ba las skyo bar 'gyur ba de gal te so so'i skye bos mngon sum du bya bar nus na ni de'i tshe skad cig de nyid la 'di'i snying lus dang lhan cig tu rnam pa brgyar 'jig par

original: 'gyur ba zhig nam rtogs pa'i phyir na 'di grogs po'i gsob kyis g-yogs pa'i dgra la bya ba ltar 'khor ba la mngon par dga'o //

original: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i bsam pa brtan pos bzung ba ni byas pa shes pa nyid dang snying rje chen po'i thabs dang stobs dag gis de ltar skyo ba'i rgyu ma yin pas gzhan la phan pa'i bya
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal sems can thams cad la phan gdags pa'i bsam pa brtan pos bzung ba ni byas pa shes pa nyid dang snying rje chen po'i thabs dang stobs dag gis de ltar skyo ba'i rgyu ma yin pas gzhan la phan pa'i bya
translated: The suffering of samsara that is taken up by the noble ones with the intention of benefiting all sentient beings is not a cause of weariness due to the methods and powers of gratitude and great compassion.

original: ba la gzhol bde rnams la gtan nas 'jig pa dogs par bya bar mi nus la /
analyzed: ba la gzhol bde rnams la gtan nas 'jig pa dogs par bya bar mi nus la /

analyzed: gal te 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rnam pa thams cad du shes na nges par rdul phra rab tu 'jig par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: gnod sbyin gyis brlams pa dang / dbang pos byis pa bzhin no //

original: 'ga' zhig ni gnod sbyin gyis mngon par brlams shing gnod sbyin de yang des ma mthong bar gyur pa dang / de 'di snyam du re zhig gnod sbyin de ma mthong bar sdug bsngal 'di 'dra ba byung na gal te mthong na ni bdag gi lus phyag dar spar gang ltar rnam par 'jig par 'gyur ro snyam du sems so //

translated: Some, like the child of a king, do not see the demon that possesses them, and they think: ‚ÄúIf I do not see this demon, I am already in a bad way; what will happen if I see it?‚Äù

original: yang ji ltar sde sna gzhon nu dpon thabs la chags pas srog yongs su btang nas sde sna nyid slar 'dzin pa de bzhin du byis pa'i skye bo yang gal te 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khong du chud na de'i 'jigs pas srid pa thams cad yongs su gtang
analyzed: yang ji ltar sde sna gzhon nu dpon thabs la chags pas srog yongs su btang nas sde sna nyid slar 'dzin pa de bzhin du byis pa'i skye bo yang gal te 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal khong du chud na de'i 'jigs pas srid pa thams cad yongs su gtang
translated: Moreover, just as the general of the army, because of his attachment to the position of general, gives up his life to protect the army, in the same way, if childish beings understood the suffering of cyclic existence, they would give up all of cyclic existence out of fear of it.

original: ba gtan du 'jig par 'gyur te thar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba gtan du 'jig par 'gyur te thar ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩsangs rgyas rnams kyis sdig pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / sangs rgyas rnams kyis sdig pa yi //
translated: Here we say:üîΩHow do the buddhas know

original: 'bras bu ci 'dra mkhyen ji ltar //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci 'dra mkhyen ji ltar //

original: ji ltar byis pas shes na de //
analyzed: ji ltar byis pas shes na de //

original: skad cig de la brgyal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig de la brgyal bar 'gyur //

analyzed: gzhan yang 'khor ba 'di ni bya ba dag la nus pa dang ldan zhing g-yo bar gyur pa bde bar 'gyur na /

original: de yang nges par dpyad pa na //
analyzed: de yang nges par dpyad pa na //
translated: But when this is investigated,

analyzed: sems can rlom pa can min dkon // rlom @128a * //

analyzed: can snying rje ldan pa med //

original: des na snang ba nas snang bar //
analyzed: des na snang ba nas snang bar //
translated: Therefore, from light to light,

analyzed: 'gro ba shin tu rnyed dkar gsungs //

analyzed: gang las bde ba nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba brtse ba med pa la ni ngan 'gro'i mthar thug pa nyid kyi 'byor ba dag ga la yod ;

analyzed: rigs dang / longs spyod dang / phyug pa las skyes pa'i nga rgyal gyis nges par thur du ltung ba'i phyir ro //

analyzed: snying brtse ba med pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'os par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'os par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba ni gcig tu dgongs pa yin no zhi na bshad par bya ste /

analyzed: phyin ci log pa nyid kyi phyir chos la yang chags par mi rigs so / 'di ltar / 'di na yul log gyur pa la //
translated: It is not reasonable to be attached to the Dharma because it is erroneous.üîΩThus,üîΩIn this world, an object is known

analyzed: yul na dmigs par grags gyur te // phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i chos /

analyzed: phyug po'i rigs sam mtho ris su skyes pa la yul yid du 'ong ba dag dmigs so //

original: gang gi phyir 'di 'dor ba'i rang bzhin yin pa bzhin du rang gis thob pa'i ngo bo can gyi 'bras bu mngon @128b par sgrub par byed pa de'i phyir na chos ni phyin ci log yin no //

analyzed: dam pa rnams mi bzhed pa gang zhig gis khas blangs pa ste /

analyzed: lug brdung bar 'dod pa bzhin no /

analyzed: ji ltar lug ni brdung bar 'dod pa na rings por song ba yang log pa ma yin pa de bzhin du yul log cing yul don du gnyer pa yang yin no //
translated: Just as one who wants to beat a goat goes quickly, but does not go back, so one who is mistaken about the object and who pursues the object is also like that.

analyzed: de ltar na re zhig chos kyang phyin ci log nyid yin pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no //

original: las de'i 'bras bu phyug pa gang yin pa de yang rang dbang du gyur pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal rnam pa sna tshogs kyi gnas yin pa nyid kyi phyir na mkhas pas re ba gzhag par mi bya ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar / bsod nams 'bras bu phyug pa ste //

analyzed: de gzhan las yongs bsrung bya na //

analyzed: rtag tu gzhan las bsrung bya gang //

analyzed: bla ma bzhin no //

analyzed: @129a * // de yi phyir na chos pas kyang //

analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gi chags par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyis sdang bar bya ba dang / rmongs par bya bar @133a * //

analyzed: bshad par bya ste / 'ga' la'ang gang dang lhan cig tu //

original: mi slob pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa ste /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sku dang gsung dang thugs thub pa dang ldan pas na thub pa ste /

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //

original: de nyid mi rtag pa dang stong pa nyid nye bar ston pas na dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin ji lta ba de bzhin du gshegs shing thugs su chud pas de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'i gzhan ni ma yin te /

translated: Since he teaches thatness, impermanence and emptiness, he is the Tathagata, because he has gone and understood things as they are in reality. He is not something else.

original: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid kyi don ji ltar gnas pa bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa'i sgo nas de kho na nyid kyi don ji ltar gnas pa bzhin ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro //

original: ji skad du /üîΩ'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar byung //
analyzed: ji skad du / 'das dang ma 'ongs da ltar byung //
translated: As it is said:üîΩAll things of the past,üîΩthe future and the present

original: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin nyid ;
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad de bzhin nyid ;
translated: have thatness.

original: / ji ltar de bzhin gzigs des na //
analyzed: / ji ltar de bzhin gzigs des na //

original: de la de bzhin gshegs par bsnyad //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs par bsnyad //

analyzed: ces bya ba dang / rab 'byor de bzhin gshegs pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni gang du yang mi gshegs la gang nas kyang ma byon pa ste /
translated: Subhuti, the Tathagata, the Tathagata, is not going anywhere and has not come from anywhere.

original: des na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes @146a * //
analyzed: des na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes @146a * //
translated: Therefore he is called the Tathagata.

original: bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar thugs su chud pa des na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bya ba dang / de bzhin du de bzhin nyid ji lta ba de ltar thugs su chud pa des na de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: And likewise, because he has realized suchness just as it is, he is called the TathƒÅgata.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang kun 'byung ba'i chos can de ni gdon mi za bar 'gog pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang kun 'byung ba'i chos can de ni gdon mi za bar 'gog pa'i chos can te /
translated: Or else, the BhagavƒÅn has said, ‚ÄúAny phenomenon that has the quality of origination necessarily has the quality of cessation.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bstan pa'i phyir skyes pa gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu 'jig pa kho na zhig ste skye ba ni de'i don du yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bstan pa'i phyir skyes pa gang yin pa de'i 'bras bu 'jig pa kho na zhig ste skye ba ni de'i don du yin pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it is taught that ‚Äòaging and death have birth as their condition,‚Äô whatever is born has only destruction as its effect, because birth is for the sake of that.

original: de'i phyir thams cad 'bras bu'i don du skye ba des na rtag pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad 'bras bu'i don du skye ba des na rtag pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since everything is born for the sake of an effect, it does not exist permanently.

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not exist essentially.

original: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir /üîΩthub pa ma rtogs ji lta'i dngos //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di de ltar yin pa de'i phyir / thub pa ma rtogs ji lta'i dngos //
translated: Since this is the case,üîΩhow could the Sage‚Äôs nature

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod ma yin //
translated: be like that of a non-realized being?

original: 'di'i don ni gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni gong ma bzhin no //
translated: The meaning is as explained above.

original: rnam pa gcig tu na tshor ba gsum myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yul dang dus dang lus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis myong bar bya ba rnams la de dag med par las kyi 'bras bu yang dag par myong ba med pas de'i don du phyi dang
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na tshor ba gsum myong bar 'gyur ba'i las yul dang dus dang lus kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par gyis myong bar bya ba rnams la de dag med par las kyi 'bras bu yang dag par myong ba med pas de'i don du phyi dang
translated: In one sense, the three types of karma to be experienced are experienced due to the specific circumstances of the object, time, and body. Since the experience of the result of karma is not without those, external and internal things arise for the sake of that.

original: nang gi dngos po dag skye ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad 'bras bu'i don du skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po dag skye ba'i phyir dngos po thams cad 'bras bu'i don du skye ba'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, all things do not exist essentially as arising for the sake of a result.

original: des na rtag pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rtag pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, permanence does not exist.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na ni rang bzhin ldog pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na ni rang bzhin ldog pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du 'gyur na de lta na yang ma yin no //
translated: In another sense, since the nature of things would not cease, they would be permanent. But that is not the case.

original: des na rtog pa yod min te //
analyzed: des na rtog pa yod min te //
translated: Therefore, there is no conception.

original: thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad rang bzhin gyis stong ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúall things are empty by their nature‚Äù is that they do not exist.

original: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid 'di yang ston pa gzhan gyi tshig gis ma bstan to zhes bshad pa ni de'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad stong pa nyid 'di yang ston pa gzhan gyi tshig gis ma bstan to zhes bshad pa ni de'i phyir /
translated: This emptiness of all things was not taught by the words of another teacher.

original: thub pa ma rtogs ji lta'i dngos //
analyzed: thub pa ma rtogs ji lta'i dngos //
translated: The Muni did not understand things as they are,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod ma yin // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and the Tathagata does not exist.

original: rtog ge bdag ni gang zhig pha rol po'i 'bras bu'i don du ma skyes pa nyid du khas blangs pa de ni skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: rtog ge bdag ni gang zhig pha rol po'i 'bras bu'i don du ma skyes pa nyid du khas blangs pa de ni skyes pa yin te /
translated: The logicians say: ‚ÄúThe self is that which is accepted as unarisen for the sake of the other, the effect. It is arisen,

original: 'bras bu'i don yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i don du skyes pa bzhin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don yin pa'i phyir 'bras bu'i don du skyes pa bzhin no zhes smras te /
translated: because it is for the sake of the effect, like that which is arisen for the sake of the effect.‚Äù

original: 'dir re zhig pha rol pos kun brtags pa sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rdul phra rab skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la nam mkha'i me tog ltar rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir re zhig pha rol pos kun brtags pa sa dang chu dang me dang rlung gi rdul phra rab skye ba dang 'jig pa dang mi ldan pa rnams la nam mkha'i me tog ltar rgyu med pa nyid kyi phyir yod pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the other, the imagined, the particles of earth, water, fire, and wind, which are without origination and destruction, do not exist, because, like a sky flower, they are without a cause.

original: yod pa ma yin pa 'di rnams la rgyu nyid du sgro btags nas skye ba grub pas mi @146b rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa 'di rnams la rgyu nyid du sgro btags nas skye ba grub pas mi @146b rtag pa nyid du sgrub pa rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to prove that things are impermanent by superimposing a cause on these nonexistents and then proving that they arise.

original: rang nyid la 'bras bu'i don ma grub pa'i phyir la gzhan la grub pa gtan tshigs su khas len na ha cang yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang nyid la 'bras bu'i don ma grub pa'i phyir la gzhan la grub pa gtan tshigs su khas len na ha cang yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you yourself have not established the meaning of the effect, and if you accept that the establishment of something else is a logical reason, then that would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: dngos po mi rigs pa khas blangs pas pha rol po bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na rtag pa 'bras bu'i don nyid du khas blangs par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po mi rigs pa khas blangs pas pha rol po bzlog par bya ba yin pa'i phyir na rtag pa 'bras bu'i don nyid du khas blangs par rigs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because you accept that things are illogical, it is also illogical to accept that permanence is the meaning of the effect in order to refute the opponent.

original: 'dis gzhan gyi dam bca' la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dis gzhan gyi dam bca' la rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba brjod par rigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to state that the opponent‚Äôs thesis contradicts an inference because

original: de ni gnyi ga la grub pa kho nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gnyi ga la grub pa kho nas brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is stated only by both parties.

original: gang gi ltar na gnyi ga la grub pa'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir rang la grub pas kyang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod do zhes 'dod pa de ltar na yang don ston pa la mi mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur
analyzed: gang gi ltar na gnyi ga la grub pa'i sgo nas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa mi srid pa'i phyir rang la grub pas kyang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yod do zhes 'dod pa de ltar na yang don ston pa la mi mkhas pa nyid du 'gyur
translated: But if you maintain that it is not possible to be harmed by an inference that is established for both parties, then you are not skilled in the meaning of the scriptures,

original: te / mkhas pa ni sla bas bstan par bya ba'i don dka' bas ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: te / mkhas pa ni sla bas bstan par bya ba'i don dka' bas ston par mi byed do //
translated: because the wise do not teach a meaning that is easy to understand in a way that is difficult to understand.

original: gzhan yang nam mkha' yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu bskyed pa la rgyu nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / khams drug 'don pas gang zag tu btags pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i don de nyid ni ma nges pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang nam mkha' yang mig gi rnam par shes pa dang myu gu bskyed pa la rgyu nyid du brjod pa'i phyir dang / khams drug 'don pas gang zag tu btags pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu'i don de nyid ni ma nges pa nyid kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, because space is said to be the cause of the arising of eye consciousness and the cause of the arising of sprouts, and because it is the cause of the designation of the person in the statement ‚ÄúThe six elements of the eye,‚Äù the meaning of the result is not ascertained.

original: gal te rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshul las ni nam mkha' la rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhe na de ni de de ltar ma yin te //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ni rnam par 'gyur ba na gzhan gyi rgyu ru 'gyur ba ste zhes bya ba'i tshul las ni nam mkha' la rgyu nyid yod pa ma yin no zhe na de ni de de ltar ma yin te //
translated: If you say that space does not have the nature of a cause because it is not a cause when it is transformed into something else, that is not so.

original: der ni sa bon myu gu'i rgyu nyid du yin pa ltar gang gis byed pa de rgyu yin no zhes skyed par byed pa kho na rgyur mngon par 'dod la /
analyzed: der ni sa bon myu gu'i rgyu nyid du yin pa ltar gang gis byed pa de rgyu yin no zhes skyed par byed pa kho na rgyur mngon par 'dod la /
translated: Only that which is the producer is asserted to be the cause.

original: rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po tsam gyis ni nam mkha' yang rgyu nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan gyi dngos po tsam gyis ni nam mkha' yang rgyu nyid du 'dod pa kho na ste /
translated: But merely by the fact of being a reason, even space is asserted to be a cause.

original: de ltar mi 'dod na mdo dang bstan bcos gnyis mi 'gal bar brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod na mdo dang bstan bcos gnyis mi 'gal bar brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not assert that, one cannot say that the sutra and the treatise are not contradictory.

original: slob dpon ni rnam pa thams cad du dngos po rang bzhin med par gsung ba yin pa'i phyir grub pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par mdzad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: slob dpon ni rnam pa thams cad du dngos po rang bzhin med par gsung ba yin pa'i phyir grub pa'i sgo nas mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par mdzad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna does not prove impermanence from the perspective of an established object because he teaches that all things are essenceless.

original: de kho na nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir dang ; rtag pa nyid ltar de yang phyi nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid kyi skabs yin pa'i phyir dang ; rtag pa nyid ltar de yang phyi nas 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: This is because this is the context of reality and because permanence is refuted later, just as impermanence is.üîΩIt is said:

original: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la //üîΩcig car 'byung ba yod min zhing //
analyzed: skye dang gnas dang 'jig rnams la // cig car 'byung ba yod min zhing //
translated: Arising, enduring, and ceasingüîΩDo not occur all at once.

original: rim gyis 'byung ba yod min na //
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung ba yod min na //
translated: And they do not occur sequentially.

original: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: nam zhig 'byung ba yod par 'gyur //
translated: When will there be an existent arising?

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be explained.

original: bstan bcos @147a * //üîΩlas kyang / gal te mi rtag rtag go zhes //
analyzed: bstan bcos @147a * // las kyang / gal te mi rtag rtag go zhes //
translated: And in the treatise,üîΩIf to apprehend ‚ÄúThe impermanent as permanent‚Äù

original: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na //üîΩstong pa mi rtag pa'o zhes //
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa log yin na // stong pa mi rtag pa'o zhes //
translated: Is an error,üîΩHow is it not an error

original: 'dzin pa'ang ji ltar log ma yin //üîΩzhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'ang ji ltar log ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: To apprehend ‚ÄúThe empty as impermanent‚Äù?

original: gzhan yang dngos po ni 'jig rten las rab tu grub pa yin pa'i phyir de sgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa yongs su 'dzin pa dgos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po ni 'jig rten las rab tu grub pa yin pa'i phyir de sgrub pa la rjes su dpag pa yongs su 'dzin pa dgos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since things are well established in the world, there is no need to accept an inference to establish them.

original: gang zhig blun pa nyid kyi dngos po ma yin pa ri bong gi rva ltar yod pa ma yin pa la dngos po yod pa ma yin par mi rtogs pa de yang skye bo spyi la grags pas brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'dzin par byed du gzhug parüîΩnus pa kho na'o //
analyzed: gang zhig blun pa nyid kyi dngos po ma yin pa ri bong gi rva ltar yod pa ma yin pa la dngos po yod pa ma yin par mi rtogs pa de yang skye bo spyi la grags pas brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'dzin par byed du gzhug parüîΩnus pa kho na'o //
translated: And if someone does not understand that a non-thing, like a rabbit‚Äôs horns, which does not exist, does not exist, then that person, by the renown of the world, is able to be made to understand the meaning that is intended to be expressed.

original: dngos po yod pa nyid sgrub na ni yan lag gsum yang bsgrub par bya ba ltar ma grub pa'i phyir don gyi sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid sgrub na ni yan lag gsum yang bsgrub par bya ba ltar ma grub pa'i phyir don gyi sgrub par byed pa mi srid pa nyid do //
translated: If the existence of the entity is being established, then the three members are not established as the probandum, and so the establishment of the object is impossible.

original: de'i phyir rtog ge ba rnams kyis rtog ge byed pa'i ngal ba don med pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog ge ba rnams kyis rtog ge byed pa'i ngal ba don med pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, we understand that the efforts of logicians to engage in logic are pointless.

original: de ltar yin dang de'i phyir rtog ge'i mtshan nyid ma rtogs par gyur du zin kyang 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par gtan la phebs pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis dngos po gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de de kho na ltar rtogs la gzhan dag la stonüîΩpar yang byed do //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang de'i phyir rtog ge'i mtshan nyid ma rtogs par gyur du zin kyang 'jig rten pa'i don rnam par gtan la phebs pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis dngos po gang zhig ji ltar gnas pa de de kho na ltar rtogs la gzhan dag la ston par yang byed do //
translated: Since that is the case, even though the characteristics of logic are not understood, those who are skilled in the analysis of worldly objects understand that whatever the mode of being of an object, it is just that way. They also teach others.

original: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir gang du 'jig rten gyis kyang de nges pa der de bzhin gshegs pa kho na don phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir gang du 'jig rten gyis kyang de nges pa der de bzhin gshegs pa kho na don phyin ci ma log pa gsungs pa'o zhes bya ba de brjod par mi nus pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, since impermanence is renowned in the world, it cannot be said that the TathƒÅgata alone teaches the unmistaken object in those cases where the world ascertains it.
